text.text_translated: Suzanne Collins has always found war news programmes upsetting, because they reminded her of her father’s service. When she was a child, her father was a pilot in the U.S. Air Force who fought in Vietnam. Her mother tried to protect Suzanne by not telling her details of the conflict, but she still saw news reports about the war and knew her father was there. This was a very frightening experience for her.
